description_txt: stated on May 1, 2013 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama’s proposed budget includes two new tax increases that would collect about $14 billion.

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2013 in a comment on WPRO radio.:
quote_txt: Boston Marathon bombing suspect Tamerlan Tsarnaev is buried "not far" from President Kennedy’s grave.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • May 17, 2013

description_txt: stated on May 1, 2013 in news release, website:
quote_txt: Ken Lanci is a lifelong Clevelander

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2013 in an interview on MSNBC:
quote_txt: "The Affordable Care Act is bringing the cost of health care in our country down."

description_txt: stated on May 9, 2013 in an op-ed:
quote_txt: "Expanding Medicaid would require borrowing more money, drastically expanding our deficit."

description_txt: stated on May 3, 2013 in A radio ad:
quote_txt: "Under Republican Governor Chris Christie, tolls cost more. Train and bus rides cost more. College tuition goes up. But Christie protected a tax cut for millionaires."

description_txt: stated on May 8, 2013 in a radio show:
quote_txt: "The State of Wisconsin thinks you should have to" wash your hands "at least 28 times to make one peanut butter-and-jelly sandwich."

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2013 in an opinion column.:
quote_txt: Says nearly 1 million people are "coming to town" in the next 20 years.

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2013 in House of Representatives floor speech :
quote_txt: "The Social Security trust fund is sound. Without anything being done, it would function well into 2038; and even after that time with no changes, we could pay 80 percent of the benefits that people have earned."

description_txt: stated on May 14, 2013 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Kelly Ayotte voted to "fix background checks."

description_txt: stated on May 6, 2013 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: "We had people that were getting killed (in Benghazi), we had people who are willing to risk their lives to go save them, and somebody told them to stand down."

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2013 in a press availability:
quote_txt: "Over the last several months, there was a review board headed by two distinguished Americans, Mike Mullen and Tom Pickering, who investigated every element of" the Benghazi incident.

description_txt: stated on May 3, 2013 in television advertisement:
quote_txt: The Georgia Lottery paid out $2.3 billion in prizes during the last fiscal year.

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2013 in his weekly radio address.:
quote_txt: Says "we" have put more boots on the U.S.-Mexico border "than at any time in our history, and illegal crossings are down by nearly 80 percent from their peak in 2000."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2013 in a White House press briefing:
quote_txt: When Susan Rice spoke about Benghazi on Sunday news shows, she said "that al-Qaida might be involved, or other al-Qaida affiliates might be involved, or non-al-Qaida Libyan extremists, which I think demonstrates that there was no effort to play that down."

description_txt: stated on May 6, 2013 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: "70,000 three-year-olds and four-year-olds across America will lose access to the preschool Head Start program. ... 2,000 in the state of Florida alone."

description_txt: stated on April 29, 2013 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: "Only three in 10 young Americans under 30 -- 30 percent under 30 -- have full-time work."

description_txt: stated on April 23, 2013 in news release:
quote_txt: Ohio’s lost more jobs in March than any other state in the nation.

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2013 in television interview:
quote_txt: Wars in Afghanistan and Iraq have cost every U.S. family $45,000.

description_txt: stated on May 1, 2013 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "Four balanced budgets in a row, with no new taxes for anyone. The best job growth in 12 years. Nearly 130,000 new private-sector jobs. Merit pay to reward New Jersey’s best teachers, and the most education funding ever."

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2013 in a House Finance Committee hearing:
quote_txt: "Two years ago Providence alone spent $50,000 a year notifying the school department" about residents in the state's sex offender registry.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • May 12, 2013

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2013 in a House Finance Committee hearing:
quote_txt: In Cranston, it costs $5,000 to $6,000 to send out community notifications on just one Level 3 sex offender.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • May 12, 2013

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2013 in a newsletter:
quote_txt: Says "Did you know that if you accepted the District's proposal today you would have NO pay increase for 4 years? Seven years of frozen wages = Disrespect."

description_txt: stated on April 27, 2013 in remarks at FreedomWorks Texas Summit in Austin:
quote_txt: Says he has sued the Obama administration 25 times.

description_txt: stated on May 7, 2013 in a legislative meeting:
quote_txt: A Wisconsin bill to limit use of food stamps for junk food would also "prevent -- or limit --  the extent to which" food stamps could be used for organic foods.

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: U.S. Rep. John Barrow of Georgia has helped support the implementation of "Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on April 7, 2013 in a television interview:
quote_txt: North Korea has a "substantial standing army, one of the largest, certainly the largest per capita, in the world."

description_txt: stated on May 8, 2013 in an email blast.:
quote_txt: "The economy added more jobs during four years under Obama than it did in the entire eight years under George W. Bush."

description_txt: stated on May 9, 2013 in an advertisement:
quote_txt: "Over the last 10 years, Texas created 33 percent of the net new jobs nationwide."

description_txt: stated on May 9, 2013 in an interview with MSNBC's "Morning Joe":
quote_txt: "In 2010, everybody said you can't dare let guns go into the national parks, and of course the rapes, murders, robberies and assaults are down about 85 percent since we did that."
